Human aging is when people grow old. It happens as time passes. The body changes, like bones getting weaker, skin wrinkling, and hair turning gray. People may also have more health problems as they age. This is because cells in the body stop working as well as they used to. It's a normal part of life, but it happens at different speeds for everyone.

Human aging is when our bodies change over time. This happens as cells grow old and stop working right. Some parts of the body age faster than others. Our skin gets wrinkles and our bones get weaker. We also might not see or hear as well. This is normal, but it can make daily tasks harder.

Here's the paragraph:

"People grow old. This is called aging. As we get older, our bodies change. We might not see as well, hear as good, or move as fast. Our skin gets wrinkles. Inside, our organs like heart and lungs don't work as strong. This is because cells in our body stop dividing and die. Also, waste builds up. This is normal. It happens to everyone."

Human aging is when people grow old. As they grow older, their bodies change. They might get wrinkles, or their hair might turn gray. They may also have more trouble seeing or hearing. Inside their bodies, parts like the heart and lungs work a bit slower. This is because cells in their body are wearing out. But don't worry, this happens to everyone. It's a normal part of life.

Human aging is when people grow older and their bodies change. They may have less energy, see and hear worse, and have more health problems. This happens because cells in our body get old and stop working as well. Scientists think this is caused by damage from everyday living, like eating and breathing. There is no cure for aging, but we can live healthier lives by eating right, exercising, and not smoking. This can help us age slower and live longer.
